Title: Object: Mamalukes exercising in the square of Mourad Bey's Palace
Series: Views in Egypt, Palestine and other parts of the Ottoman Empire
Description: Plate 35 in volume I: a large crowd of mamelukes with turbans, standing in the square, holding sticks, exercising; spectators standing at a veranda on the left and seated at windows; Murad Bey seated in a balcony; after Mayer; published state. 1802 Hand-coloured aquatint with etching
Bibliographic references: Abbey Travel / Travel in Aquatint and lithography 1770-1860 from the library of J.R.Abbey (369.I.35)
Acquisition notes: Ther album was transferred from the Department of Egyptian and Assyrian Antiquities.
